snippet: China’s campaign has provoked sometimes spectacular protests, including church members who have climbed spires to shield crosses.
abstract: China's campaign in Zhejiang Province to remove crosses from churches has sparked unexpectedly large backlash in country's growing Christian community; analysts say most surprising aspect of protests are open letters written by officials in government-approved churches.

byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: China’s campaign has provoked sometimes spectacular protests, including church members who have climbed spires to shield crosses.

headline.main: Chinese Christians Resist Government Plan to Remove Crosses
headline.print_headline: China’s Effort to Take Down Church Crosses Meets Dissent
